section.title: The IERS
section.para: If you want to find out more about the models and algorithms implemented in the libiers10++ package, visit the IERS website. This site also contains a lot of information and links, about various other resources (e.g. documents, technical notes, software, products, etc).

The IERS Conventions Center Home operated since 2001 by The Bureau International des Poids et Mesures (BIPM) and the US Naval Observatory (USNO) contains material describing reference systems realized by the IERS and the models and procedures used for this purpose.

section.title: IERS Conventions (2010)
section.para: The fundamentsl document describing (among others) all the models and algorithms contained within libiers10++ package, are described in IERS Technical Note No. 36, named as IERS Conventions (2010). This document is a must if you plan on using the library or any part of it. It is freely available for download at the IERS website (here is a direct link).
Please consult this document before using the package!
Note that the table is organized according to the chapters of the Technical Note No. 36.
